item.title: Adaptive control of linear systems
item.description: We start with a simple example to illustrate that it is possible to control a linear system with unknown dymamics. Consider a scalar linear system \[ x_{t+1} = a x_t + b u_t + w_t \] where \(x_t, u_t, w_t \in \reals\) and \(\{w_t\}_{t \ge 1}\) is an i.i.d. process with zero mean and variance \(σ^2\). Suppse the per-step cost is \(c(x_t, u_t) = x_t^2\) and our objective is to minimize the long-term average cost \[ \lim_{T \to ∞} \frac{1}{T} \EXP\Bigl[ \sum_{t=1}^T x_t^2 \Bigr].
